The_Dirt_Drifters:
{{Short description|American country music group}}{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2012}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Dirt Drifters | image = | caption = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2010–2012 | label = [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = Matt Fleener
Ryan Fleener
Jeff Middleton
Jeremy Little
Nick Diamond }} '''The Dirt Drifters''' was an American [[country music]] group made up of five musicians: lead singer/guitarist Matt Fleener, vocalist/guitarist Ryan Fleener, vocalist/guitarist Jeff Middleton, bassist Jeremy Little and drummer Nick Diamond.{{cite web|url=http://www.thedirtdrifters.com/bio/|title=Bio|work=The Dirt Drifters|accessdate=August 10, 2011}} They were signed to [[Warner Bros. Records]] and their debut CD, ''This Is My Blood'', was released on July 19, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/the-dirt-drifters-interview-2011/|title=The Dirt Drifters Will Always Have a 'Reason' for Making Country Music|last=Conaway|first=Alanna|date=June 29, 2011|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=July 18, 2011}} Their debut single, "Something Better," was released in February 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.theboot.com/2011/03/04/the-dirt-drifters-interview/|title=Dirt Drifters Bring 'Something Better' to Country Music|last=Duvall|first=Erin|date=March 4, 2011|work=The Boot|accessdate=March 10, 2011}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
